name: Valkey LXC
description: Valkey is an open source (BSD) high-performance key/value datastore that supports a variety of workloads.
script:
#!/bin/bash
# install Valkey LXC
wget https://example.com/valkey-lxc.sh -O valkey-lxc.sh
bash valkey-lxc.sh

script:
#!/bin/bash
# install Qdrant LXC
wget https://example.com/qdrant-lxc.sh -O qdrant-lxc.sh
bash qdrant-lxc.sh

name: Docker LXC
description: Docker is an open-source project for automating the deployment of applications as containers.
script:
#!/bin/bash
# install Docker LXC
wget https://example.com/docker-lxc.sh -O docker-lxc.sh

name: Line Type Tool
slug: Create Lines based on SvN Approved Standards
description: The Line Type Tool can be used to import SvN's standard line types into an existing project. When used, it audits the model's existing line types, imports any missing ones, and replaces matching types with SvN BIM Standards. For individual or one-off new line types, use standard Revit processes.
script:
# üü£ Line Type Tool

The **Line Type Tool** allows users to import SvN‚Äôs standard line types into a Revit project in one action.

When activated, it:

- Audits all line types in the project  
- Imports missing SvN-standard line types  
- Replaces existing types with matching SvN-standard ones  
- Maintains consistency with SvN BIM Standards  

---

## ‚ñ∂ Regular Revit Workflow (For Single Line Types)

If only one new line type is required, use native Revit tools:

**Manage ‚Üí Additional Settings ‚Üí Line Styles**

---

## üì© Need New Standards?

For projects that require new or expanded BIM standards  
(e.g., collaboration with consultants, BEP requirements, shared standards):

üëâ **Contact [@Jason Tian](mailto:jtian@svn-ap.com)**

---

# üì∏ Line Styles & Patterns Comparison

Below is the comparison of default line types vs. SvN standards after import:

![Line Styles and Patterns Comparison](./images/line-type-tool.png)

> *(Replace the image path above with your actual hosted URL if needed.)*

---

## üìÇ Data Source

All line style and pattern settings are derived from:

```
N:\Library\Design Software\Autodesk\Revit\Standards\Line Type\Linetypes.xlsx
```

---
